register.description: Global software cold and warm reset control. This register is auto-cleared. Only write 1 is possible. A read returns 0 only.

bitfield.description: Global COLD software reset control. [[br]]This bit is reset only upon a global cold source of reset.

bitenum.description: 0X1 : Asserts a global COLD software reset. The software must ensure the SDRAM is properly put in sef-refresh mode before applying this reset.
0X0 : Global COLD software reset is cleared.

bitfield.description: Global WARM software reset control. [[br]]This bit is reset upon any global source of reset (warm and cold).

bitenum.description: 0X1 : Asserts a global warm software reset.
0X0 : Global warm software reset is cleared.

register.description: This register logs the global reset sources. Each bit is set upon release of the domain reset signal. Must be cleared by software. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: IcePick reset event. [[br]]This is a source of global warm reset initiated by the emulation. [[br]][warm reset insensitive]
External warm reset event [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: 0X1 : Global external warm reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: Watchdog1 timer reset event. [[br]]This is a source of global WARM reset. [[br]][warm reset insensitive]
Global warm software reset event [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: 0X1 : Global warm SW reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: Power-on (cold) reset event [warm reset insensitive]
(Power domain) reset duration 2 (number of RM.SYSCLK clock cycles)
(Global) reset duration 1 (number of SYS_CLK clock cycles)

register.description: Common setup for SRAM LDO transition counters. Applies to all voltage domains. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines the start-up duration of SRAM and ABB LDO. [[br]]The duration is computed as 16 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. [[br]]Target is 50us.
Delay between retention/off assertion of last SRAM bank and SRAMALLRET signal to LDO is driven high. [[br]]Counting on system clock. [[br]]Target is 2us.
SRAM LDO rampup time from retention to active mode. [[br]]The duration is computed as 8 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. [[br]]Target is 30us.
Delay between de-assertion of standby_rta_ret_on and standby_rta_ret_good. [[br]]Counting on system clock. [[br]]Target is 600ns.

register.description: Setup of the SRAM LDO for CORE voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Override on AIPOFF input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: AIPOFF signal is overriden to '1'. Corresponding SRAM LDO is disabled and in HZ mode.

bitfield.description: ENFUNC5 input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: Active to retention is a two steps transfer
Active to retention is a one step transfer

bitfield.description: ENFUNC4 input of SRAM LDO.
ENFUNC3 input of SRAM LDO. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC2 input of SRAM LDO. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC1 input of SRAM LDO. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during deep-sleep. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during active mode. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

Control for HD memory RTA feature. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this. [[br]]Note : This feature is not used.

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Control and status of the SRAM LDO for CORE voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Status indicating SRAM LDO state machine state.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO state machine is in transition state
SRAM LDO state machine is stable

bitfield.description: SRAMLDO status
Control if the SRAM LDO retention mode is used or not.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO go to RET mode when all memory of voltage domain are OFF or RET
SRAM LDO is not allowed to go to RET mode

register.description: Setup of the SRAM LDO for MPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Override on AIPOFF input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: AIPOFF signal is overriden to '1'. Corresponding SRAM LDO is disabled and in HZ mode.

bitfield.description: ENFUNC5 input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: Active to retention is a two steps transfer
Active to retention is a one step transfer

bitfield.description: ENFUNC4 input of SRAM LDO.
ENFUNC3 input of SRAM LDO. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC2 input of SRAM LDO. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC1 input of SRAM LDO. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during deep-sleep. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during active mode. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

Control for HD memory RTA feature. [[br]]After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. [[br]]Bitfield remains writable after this.

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Control and status of the SRAM LDO for MPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Status indicating SRAM LDO state machine state.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO state machine is in transition state
SRAM LDO state machine is stable

bitfield.description: SRAMLDO status
Control if the SRAM LDO retention mode is used or not.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO go to RET mode when all memory of voltage domain are OFF or RET
SRAM LDO is not allowed to go to RET mode

register.description: This register allows controlling EMIF IO isolation removal setup. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines the setup time of the DDR IOs going out of isolation. [[br]]Counting on the system clock. [[br]]Target is 1.5us.

register.description: This register allows controlling power management features of the IOs.

bitfield.description: IO ISO Status.
IO ISO control. [[br]]writing this bit to '1' will kick off IO isolation.
Global IO wakeup enable. [[br]]This is a gating condition to all individual IO WUEN coming from control module. [[br]]Gating is done in the Spinner logic.

bitenum.description: All individual IO WUEN from control module are going to IOs.
All individual IO WUEN are gated in the Spinner logic (overriden to 0).

bitfield.description: Gives value of WUCLKOUT signal coming back from IO pad ring.
Direct control on WUCLKIN signal to IO pad ring.

bitenum.description: WUCLKIN signal is driven to 1. IO wakeup daisy chain is reset and is latching current pad states and WUEN inputs.
WUCLKIN signal is driven to 0. IO wakeup daisy chain is functional as well as IO whose wakeup feature is enabled.

bitfield.description: Gives the functional status of the IO ring.

bitenum.description: All IOs are in the ON state.
Part or all of the IOs are not in the ON state, that is are in isolation state.

bitfield.description: Control non-EMIF IO isolation extension.

bitenum.description: Non-EMIF IO isolation is extended. "EMIF_ON" IO transition is stalled.
Non-EMIF IO isolation is not extended. "EMIF_ON" IO transition happens as soon as automatic restore is completed.

bitfield.description: Gives value of ISOCLKOUT signal coming back from IO pad ring.
Override control on ISOCLKIN signal to IO pad ring.When not overriden, this signal is controlled by hardware only.

bitenum.description: ISOCLKIN signal is overriden to active value ('1').

register.description: This MMR has flag to indicate OPP change to EMIF to allow read/write leveling.

bitfield.description: This bit controls read-write leveling of EMIF memories (DDR3). [[br]]It must be set in case OPP voltage change is done.

register.description: This register controls EMIF controller low power configurations.

bitfield.description: Reserved

EMIF Controller DeepSleep Mode Enable. [[br]]This bit should be programmed to '1' (ON) before going into DeepSleep. [[br]]Must be cleared to '0' (OFF) after wakeup and EMIF configuration is completed.

bitenum.description: EMIF Controller DeepSleep Mode is Enabled.
EMIF Controller DeepSleep Mode is Disabled.
